header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Weather, regional dialect, living environments, relationships, directing, work, training, parking.
header.activity: Daily chit-chat while driving around Brighton
header.conv_type: Discussing, explaining, inquiring, complaining, anecdote telling

so yep er I suppose I mean if it's a small car you might be alright nothing too dramatic copper car there I was er I've been doing dialects in my linguistics class recently one of them and there's this thing online you can go on and click on different recordings of people around England so just for curiosity I clicked on one in Gravesend wondering what it would be like
oh yeah
and it was a bloody old diddicoy man
old travellers on an estate that have settled

and they were into it was an hour long a complete waste of time it wasn't relevant to what I was looking for but I got sucked into it anyway listening to him talk for an hour and I'd ask him words like what would you say for this and what would you say for that and it was making me realise all these words so when came back after the weekend I said what does parnyard mean?
he said he didn't know I was like you like that's another word I didn't realise parnyard gattered gattered is another one yeah erm
cos you've been brought up with them
yeah I really didn't there's still some and because also I think I think I use them around people in Medway and I think I'm familiar enough with them to know what they mean
yeah
or they use them themselves
